companies.name: Perplexity AI
companies.reason: Perplexity AI is trending due to its innovative AI-powered search engine that provides direct answers with citations, challenging traditional search models. Founded in 2022 and headquartered in San Francisco, California, with approximately 250 employees, it's a significant innovator in the AI search space, attracting substantial investment and attention as an emerging tech company.

companies.name: Glean
companies.reason: Glean is trending as an AI-powered enterprise search and knowledge management platform designed to help employees find information across various work applications. Founded in 2019 and based in Palo Alto, California, with over 600 employees, its innovation lies in unifying disparate data sources for intelligent search. It was recognized on CNBC's Disruptor 50 list, highlighting its disruptive potential in business productivity.

companies.name: Deepgram
companies.reason: Deepgram is trending for its advanced AI-powered speech recognition platform, offering developers sophisticated APIs for speech-to-text, text-to-speech, and speech-to-speech conversion. Founded in 2015 and headquartered in San Francisco, California, with around 180 employees, its innovation is in providing accurate and fast audio intelligence for voice-first applications. It has secured significant funding and is a key player in the Voice AI sector.
